main event: A bright blinking light was sighted moving at tremendous speed from northeast to southwest, before suddenly disappearing.
interesting points: The object could not be clearly identified, and details of its description were vague and uncertain.
The object disappeared at high speed under unaccounted for conditions.
Theodolite measurements were taken, recording the object's azimuth and elevation over time.
The object's color changed from white to green and red, and then to black when it was nearly stationary.
The object's brightness diminished somewhat after about an hour, possibly due to thin cirrus clouds.
witnesses: base operations and weather tower personnel
